rules: Rule1: Under the condition that the sustainable technology project is research active, funding is secured for the sustainable technology project.

Rule2: Whenever funding is secured for the sustainable technology project, then either data analysis is complete for plant growth data, or if the publication of forest research results does not imply the lack of a completed field study, forest research is peer reviewed.
Rule3: There is an environmental disturbance at the forest site, or the forest habitat ecosystem is not stable.
Rule4: Under the condition that the data collection protocol is followed, then if remote sensors are monitoring actively, there is no environmental disturbance at the forest site.
Rule5: If the solar device collects data on plant growth, then whenever government funding is not available for clean technology, plant biology is a field of study in renewable energy.
Rule6: If the research station is solar operational, then the solar device collects data on plant growth.
Rule7: Provided that the research station is wind operational, the wind device collects data on plant growth.

Rule8: If data integrity is verified for plant metrics, then whenever it is not the case that the absence of solar operational or wind operational at the research station implies backup power is active at the research station, the power system is not reliable at the research station.
Rule9: Under the condition that the research findings are results reproducible, the research findings have valid conclusions.
Rule10: If the field team is present at the research site, then the solar panel is an active sensor in the plant area, or the wind turbine is an active sensor in the plant area.
Rule11: Provided that the lead researcher is onsite at the research site, the assistant researcher is onsite at the research site.

Rule12: If the wind device collects data on plant growth, then under the condition that government funding is not available for clean technology, plant biology is a field of study in renewable energy.
Rule13: If the assistant researcher is onsite at the research site, the field team is present at the research site.

Rule14: Under the condition that the methodology is approved by the research committee, then if the sustainable technology project is research active, either data analysis is complete for plant growth data, or if publishing the results of forest research does not lead to the negation of a completed field study, forest research is peer reviewed.
Rule15: If a conference presentation is scheduled by the research committee, then publication is authorized by the research committee.
Rule16: Provided that a patent is filed by the technology office, a conference presentation is scheduled by the research committee.
Rule17: If real-time data streaming is occurring from the remote sensors, there is no environmental disturbance at the forest site.
Rule18: Under the condition that the solar panel is an active sensor in the plant area, the solar device collects data on plant growth.
Rule19: If the wind turbine is an active sensor in the plant area, the wind device collects data on plant growth.
Rule20: Whenever the environmental sensor is malfunctioning, the environmental sensor requires maintenance.
Rule21: If forest research is approved research, then the results of forest research are published.
Rule22: Provided that forest research is approved research, forest research has a completed field study.
Rule23: Forest research is approved research, or government funding is available for clean technology.
Rule24: Provided that it is not the case that publishing the results of forest research leads to the negation of a completed field study, forest research is not peer reviewed.

Rule25: Under the condition that it is false that remote sensors monitoring actively implies real-time data streaming from the remote sensors, manual data collection is required for the remote sensors.
Rule26: If it is not true that remote sensors monitoring actively leads to real-time data streaming from the remote sensors, then manual data collection is not required for the remote sensors.
Rule27: Provided that it is false that the solar panel is an active sensor in the plant area or the wind turbine is an active sensor in the plant area, the environmental sensor is malfunctioning.

Rule28: Under the condition that the absence of solar operational or wind operational at the research station does not imply backup power is active at the research station, the power system is reliable at the research station.

Rule29: Under the condition that it is not the case that data integrity not verified for plant metrics leads to statistical analysis not complete for plant metrics, the research findings are results reproducible.

Rule30: Under the condition that it is false that methodology not approved by the research committee implies ethical clearance not granted by the research committee, a patent is filed by the technology office.

Rule31: If it is not the case that methodology not approved by the research committee leads to ethical clearance not granted by the research committee, publication is not authorized by the research committee.
Rule32: Provided that it is not true that government funding not available for clean technology implies a baseline not established for plant ecology, the forest habitat ecosystem is stable.
Rule33: If data integrity is not verified for plant metrics, statistical analysis is complete for plant metrics.
Rule34: Whenever methodology is not approved by the research committee, ethical clearance is granted by the research committee.
Rule35: Whenever government funding is not available for clean technology, it is not the case that plant biology is a field of study in renewable energy.
facts: Fact1: The sustainable technology project is research active.
Fact2: Remote sensors are monitoring actively.
Fact3: The data collection protocol is followed.
Fact4: The lead researcher is onsite at the research site.
Fact5: It is not the case that data analysis is complete for plant growth data.
Fact6: A baseline is not established for plant ecology.
Fact7: Backup power is not active at the research station.
Fact8: The research findings do not have valid conclusions.
Fact9: The environmental sensor does not require maintenance.

question: Government funding is available for clean technology.
